channel.title: Webclient done but
channel.description:
Sup guys as it says in the tittle I've actually done my webclient and it works for me..
I did this with a hamachi to play with my friends and code in mean while before I move onto a VPS. But a problem occured not for me but them.
They get this error:
[IMG]http://i1090.photobucket.com/albums/i375/JuniorCautionz/1.png[/img]
And then when I get my friend to check the error it says this
[IMG]http://i1090.photobucket.com/albums/i375/JuniorCautionz/2.png[/img]
Then after seeing unknowen source I figured it might of been the cache. I downloaded the cache manually on his computer and put it in his C:/ and tried going on the webclient again but it didn't work. Still the same error screen.
Can anyone tell me what the problem is or put me in a path so I can fix it.
Thank you

item.title: Webclient done but
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

dzeko:

it can’t find the jarred client so if it can’t find the jarred client then how is going to find his program file which contains your jdk? Use your brain.

you seem in a bad mood
[/quote]
I’m in a black mood.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient done but
item.dc:creator: @JuniorCautionz JuniorCautionz
item.description:
@JuniorCautionz wrote:

[quote=“heatrn11, post:6, topic:439109”][quote author=dzeko link=topic=541809.msg3969269#msg3969269 date=1334013146]
“Unsuported major.minor version 51.0”
that means you’ve compiled it with a 1.7.x version and you’re trying to run it with a lower version…
run your “Internet Explorer (64 bits)” it will work.

But to fix it
re-compile it with your Program Files (x86) jdk same thing if you’ve use x86. Compile it with your program files version…
re-upload the cache & make new client.jar…
[/quote]
No you’re wrong. What he needs to do is jar his client with jar maker and replace the “client.jar” with the link to his jarred client. It has nothing to do with the path to his jdk.

Why didn’t you put the link to the Jared client into the html? How is it suppose to connect without it?[/quote]

If you mean http://mywebsite.com/client.jar in the HTML code I tried it. Still didn’t work.

I even jarred it using my friends computer with Program files (x86). Still didn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient done but
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“dzeko, post:4, topic:439109”]“Unsuported major.minor version 51.0”
that means you’ve compiled it with a 1.7.x version and you’re trying to run it with a lower version…
run your “Internet Explorer (64 bits)” it will work.

But to fix it
re-compile it with your Program Files (x86) jdk same thing if you’ve use x86. Compile it with your program files version…
re-upload the cache & make new client.jar…[/quote]
No you’re wrong. What he needs to do is jar his client with jar maker and replace the “client.jar” with the link to his jarred client. It has nothing to do with the path to his jdk.

Why didn’t you put the link to the Jared client into the html? How is it suppose to connect without it?

Read full topic

that means you’ve compiled it with a 1.7.x version and you’re trying to run it with a lower version…
run your “Internet Explorer (64 bits)” it will work.

But to fix it
re-compile it with your Program Files (x86) jdk same thing if you’ve use x86. Compile it with your program files version…

item.title: Webclient done but
item.dc:creator: @JuniorCautionz JuniorCautionz
item.description:
@JuniorCautionz wrote:

heatrn11:

did you put the client.jar link in the html?

Yeah the client.jar is uploaded and it is inside the html code.

###### 
<BODY>

<applet name="######" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class">
<param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m">
</applet>

</BODY>
</HTML></blockquote>

This is the HTML code I’ve been using.

Read full topic
